page.title: 18GRAVEL QUARRYING (CONT.)
page.content: About 1000 tons a week is produced. Durite is exported to America and other countries. As a result of the quarrying there is about 1 square mile of lake area which is stocked with fish and run by the Canterbury and District Angling Association. A sailing club also makes use of the resultant lakes. As the lakes and surrounding marshy areas have become colonized they have become havens for wildlife. One important local breeding bird is the Cettis Warbler which has increased in numbers because of the ideal habitat created. A site near to the Frank Montgomery School is being reclaimed for the formation of a small golf course.
